RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 53. Allowance Purse 33700. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 2 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WILLIAMSBEACHBABE dueled on the lead from the rail throughout, edged clear late under strong. LEMON MOUSSE dueled with the winner throughout, was outfinished late but held place. BEAUTIFUL LASS had good position on the inside, angled out three wide in the stretch and drew close, hung late. LATE DATE was unhurried early, closed a gap on the inside. GIMME CLEARANCE raced wide early and tired after five eights. DANES LAST SONG had good position early and tired on the far turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 2 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Consider ed In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO TWOWAYSABOUTIT was well placed early, rallied, at the quarter pole, drew clear at the sixteenth pole and lasted late under strong handling. RUNLIKEJACKIEO raced mid pack early, rallied in the stretch three wide and closed fast. DIAMONDS N DEW dueled early, gained a clear lead at the quarter pole, remained clear in mid stretch and faltered late. MOBIL CHIC raced mid pack and went evenly. CAN I GO TOO was unhurried early and was no threat. MY PIE was outrun. BODE'S ROSE had speed for a half, stopped in the stretch and was eased to wire and walked off.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 97. Starter Allowance Purse 17600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 2 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances) (Multiple Winners For A Claiming Price Of $5,000 Or More In 2022 - 2023 Preferred)(Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FRONTLINER was not rushed early, rallied on the turn four wide, closed determinedly and edged clear late under strong handling. ELLE'SBIGSEACRET dueled on the lead for a half, shook clear in the stretch, was outfinished late but held place. MONTAUK COVE pressed the pace three wide, rallied in the stretch and finished willingly MAS CHIKILIN was allowed to settle early, rallied in the stretch on the rail and improved. LIMIT UP contended until mid stretch, then weakened. TRIGZ TOO dueled early and tired in the stretch. SLIPPY had brief foot, and was through after a half. JOSHY JAK contended early on the inside and was through after a half.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 26400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 2 Allo wed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RED HOT LASS pressed the early pace, rallied,at the quarter pole, finished full of run and drew off late under mild urging. WINE ME UP BABY set the pace for a half, was no match for winner late but was second best. RADIANTRITHYM was never far back and went evenly late. AUNT BEE was allowed to settle early, lacked a late bid and was no threat. CASCADE PARK raced three wide and lacked a late response. SIERRA DIAMOND pressed the early pace along the inside, lost action at the three eight pole, was pulled up on the far turn and vanned off, The stewards posted the inquiry sign but took no action..

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 12800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 2. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KHALFANI dueled on the lead for a half, shook clear in the stretch and lasted late under strong handling. CALL WEST was unhurried early, rallied seven wide in the stretch, finished fast and was gaining. DONNELS CREEK raced mid pack early, rallied in the stretch five wide with a mild bid. DIAMONDS ENJOY dueled on the inside and weakened in the stretch. QIAN B C contended four wide and lacked a late kick. WISE KHOZAN was allowed to settle early, swung five wide in the stretch and was no threat late. BOOM FIVE THOUSAND had early speed on the rail and tired in the stretch. O CIGANO went his nose at the start and lost his rider. The stewards posted the inquiry sign but took no action.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 19500. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MUCHO PRIMO was away alertly and dueled on the early lead, shook clear on the turn, was well handled throughout and prevailed. THE PINK Z pressed the pace three wide, finished willingly and held place. VICTORY DIVISION was unhurried early, angled out five wide in the stretch and finished well. SERENDIPITOUS had good position on the inside and finished evenly. THANKSDAD contended throughout and lacked a later bid. DEXQUIRE pressed the early pace and was through after a half. HEIDI'S SINATRA was outrun. HONKY TONK MUSIC had brief foot, and was through early.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: OTBO Sales Graduate Race S. MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 67. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR OHIO BRED FOALS OF 2020 WHICH HAVE PASSED THROUGH THE SALES RING AT ANY OTBO SALE. Sustaining fees paid to OTBO. Remaining eligible horses to pay $50 to nominate. $100 to enter; $150 to start. PURSE $50,000 Guaranteed by OTBO. Supplemental nomination of $2,000 will be accepted at the time of entry which includes all fees. The purse to be distributed 1% to all starters seventh through last. The remaining balance to be distributed: 60% to the winner; 20% to second; 10% to third; 5% to fourth; 3% to fift h; 2% to sixth. Weight 123 lbs. Non-winners of two races allowed 2 lbs. Maidens allowed 5 lbs. Winners preferred then highest earnings. The winner to receive all fees paid to either the Southern Park Stakes or the Howard B. Noonan Memorial Stakes from th e OTBO. Starters to be named through the entry box Monday, February 27, 2023 by the usual time of closing. Trophies presented by the OTBO to the winning Owner, Trainer, Jockey and Breeder.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHANEL SPIRIT had good position early, rallied in the stretch with a quick move and drew clear, widened late under mild urging. BRONZE KETTLE was off a step slow and trailed, angled out six wide in the stretch, closed fast and was second best. HOTROD BOBBY raced mid pack early, had a mild bid in the lane while no threat. FACTISIMFLASHY set the pace until the top of the stretch and weakened. EMERSON JONES allowed to settle, failed to menace. LUNCHATTHELIZARD chased the speed on the inside and faded. BROWNIE raced between horses, and was no threat. WILDCAT PRIDE was no factor. SWING STATE had brief foot and was through early. The stewards posted the general inquiry sign but took no action.

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, the speed on the inside and faded,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 25900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 2 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GIANT CRITIC tracked four wide, rallied on the far with a quick move and gained the lead, remained clear late under firm handling. JR'S GIFT was unhurried early, rallied on the inside down the backside, angled out four wide in the stretch and closed fast to be second best. ACROSS THE AISLE was never far back, rallied on the far turn, put in his bid and hung late. JUSTIN'S QUEST raced close up for six furlongs and weakened slightly. GILES saved ground and was no threat. BLAME IT ON EDDIE pressed early, rallied down the backside and gained a slight lead, then flattened out on the far turn. VITALE was no threat. NOT YET CHARLIE had early speed and tired. TO WIN broke in the air and lost his rider. The stewards posted the inquiry sign but took no action.

ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, and was no threat,

ENTRY.OWNER: Nana's Nest and Cline Robert C
